The whole premise of the plot seems to have been cobbled together by the writers after they'd endured an overkill of everything from the Lost in Space TV series of the sixties (though at least that show injected some humour into the proceedings), through to 2001 A Space Odyssey, and the innumerable Star Trek programmes and films.Any movie that casts Michael Caine as a scientific boffin must be struggling for starters. He utters, in one excruciatingly and barely decipherable scene, "I lied". Well he certainly didn't act! Anne Hathaway struggles to make any sense of the quite ludicrous script and often appears that she'd rather be undergoing root-canal work, whilst Matthew McConaughey mumbles and fumbles his way through lines he can't quite believe he is expected to say.The continuity is confusing and the 'special effects' only reach mediocre, adding absolutely nothing new in this genre for the viewer.I have watched hundreds of sci-fi films and programmes and do realise that we are expected to suspend belief to a greater extent, which is why a little humour would not have gone amiss - but every character in the movie seemed to be so darn miserable and brimming with angst. This film has no redeeming features whatsoever; one develops no empathy for any of the players, and there were a couple I longed would perish within a few minutes of them being introduced into the storyline (the child who portrays the ten-year old Murphy to name but one).Sorry, but this film is not worthy of wasting over two hours of your precious life on. There again, you are quite entitled to think otherwise....

title: More than a film.
content:
I don't know how could I explain my experience.If you are a human at least one,you should have to watch this movie.brillaiance at it's peak.I don't wanna say it's just a movie.Interstellar is more than a movie reality.Watch yourselves and think about this review
Thankyou

title: A complicated subject displayed as a brilliant and digestible masterpiece
content: I know nothing about astrophysics or cosmology and I watched this film 10 years ago- I was 14. Throughout the years, I've lost count on how many times I have rewatched this movie.This film tackles about such a complex matter which involves knowledge about different branches of science. As a former 14-year-old sci-fi fanatic, this movie was laid out in such a way that people will understand. While science might not be everybody's thing, this film touches the subject of family and survival; something everyone can relate to.It's a great tear-jerking film that makes people question what they know about the universe and all the possibilities it offers. At some point of the film, it will also make you question your morals and empathize with the characters.Interstellar is a thought-provoking piece that I think is a must-watch for everyone, especially Sci-fi lovers.

title: masterpiece
content: To be honest what attracted me in this movie was the soundtrack it's one of the most beautiful and amazing soundtracks I've ever heard and then i was like let's see what the movie is and thanks good i watched this everything is perfect literally everything the acting the cast the plot (it was a little hard to understand) the scenes were really good you can see how good are themI had mixed feelings I cried so much and i was surprised i didn't understand the plot from the first time but i did in the end that was one of the best experiences make sure that you watch this with high quality enjoyy.

title: The best there is, the best there was, the best will ever be
content: Just rewatched this absolute masterpiece in cinma and god what an experience, the only question while I'm watching, how nolan did this movie. Imo if there's any show could be perfect and almost had no mistakes I'd gladly say it's interstellar, no other show did what interstellar did to me, full of emotions that can do deep into your hart and your felling, great soundtracks and one of the best soundtracks of all time, touching stories, fantastic acting, perfect end which has lots of meaning.. I laughed I cried I smiled I had lots of different feelings but the only feeling that I know for sure after this rewatch is interstellar is the greatest of all time.

title: I can't believe I waited 10 years to watch this Masterpiece
content: One of the best movies ever.I don't know whether I talk about the visuals, the music, the plot, the passion, the love, the drama, the losses or the wins.Lots of things happened and lots of things felt.The father- daughter thing , the belief, the well to live, the love, the desperation, the tough decisions and just so much is there to feel.I feel like if I lived another live.I really can't believe that I have waited ten years to watch the movie. But, I am so happy I did that. Because, in one of my hardest times, I found something to get me out of there and to take me to a better place.Amazing work!
